title: Do you think that Intel's plan to reduce all of their prices on their processors by 10% will effect people choices to choose Intel over AMD? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you’re using price point as your basis of choice when choosing between AMD and Intel, chances are 10% isn’t going to sway you. I’ve built many systems using both, and over the years it has been quite clear that Intel has the superior product. I wish it weren’t so. I’d have saved thousands of dollars. One caveat though. I have not tried the new Ryzen line. I’m upgrading in the fall, and I have given it some thought, but in the end, with 10% off I ‘ll probably stick with what I believe are the better of the 2.

No, not really. The price-to-performance difference between AMD and Intel CPUs with same performance is higher than 10–15%. So Intel will still be more expensive - even including compatible motherboard. So far, Intel motherboards were already more expensive than AMD ones, so combined price-to-performance ratio still favors AMD.
